page.title: 03Farming in Easons Green
page.content: Among a variety of arable and livestock farms in the area is Brandon Farm, from which the farmer has recently retired. Instead of moving away, he has rented out some land to be arable farmed and has sold 15.5 acres. The gentleman who purchased this land for Â£22,000 six months ago intends to grow main crops of garlic, leeks and salsify. He believes the combination of good soil, a south-facing slope and an increasing demand for garlic will provide himself and his wife with a good living. They intend to live on the land although, as yet, planning permission has only been granted for a mobile home. The only building on the site at the moment is a large greenhouse which will be used to dry the garlic and to produce intermediary crops of spring cabbage and french beans.
